lexicon.models module¶

Contains the Django models used to represent lexical items and their features.

It is expected that all interaction with users should take place via the admin interface and the forms in .forms, which perform various validation/cleaning steps on the data. If you are modifying the database directly, you should ensure that the data you are touching remains clean.

  • Each LexicalItem has one FeatureSet. (e.g., [[iRel], [uT, EPP]])
  • Each FeatureSet has one or more Features. (e.g., [uT, EPP])
  • Each Feature has one or more FeatureProperties. (e.g., {name: T}, {interpretable: False}, {EPP: True})
class lexicon.models.LexicalItem(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: notify.models.NotifyModel

A Django model representing a single lexical item.

text¶

The orthographic representation of this lexical item, to be used when building up/displaying lexical arrays, etc.

language¶

A short code representing the language that this lexical item belongs to. By convention, contains a 2 letter ISO language code, optionally followed by an underscore and a 2 letter ISO country code. Other values may be used for cases that the convention cannot handle appropriately.

In addition, the special code “func” is used for functional items (which don’t belong in any particular language).

Examples

  • en
  • en_SG
  • zh
  • func
features¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

tracker¶

Used for change notifications. Subscribers will only be alerted when a substantive change is made to a model instance.

serializer_class = 'lexicon.serializers.LexicalItemSerializer'¶

Used for change notifications. Subscribers will receive the latest model data processed via this serializer.

features_string()¶

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
class lexicon.models.Feature(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A Django model representing a single syntactic feature. The same Feature can be in multiple FeatureSets, and FeatureSets consist of multiple Features.

name¶

A human-friendly short name for this Feature.

description¶

A long description of this Feature.

properties¶

A QuerySet representing the FeatureProperties of this Feature.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

lexicalitem_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

class lexicon.models.FeatureProperty(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A Django model representing a primitive property-value pair that may form a part of a feature proper. Each Feature is a collection of multiple FeatureProperties.

name¶

A human-friendly short name for this FeatureProperty.

type¶

A few standard types for the FeatureProperty, for cleaning/validation

raw_value¶

The raw value associated with this FeatureProperty.

value¶
description¶

A long description of this FeatureProperty.

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned
